xierpa3.builders.builder module¶

class xierpa3.builders.builder.Builder(e=None, result=None, verbose=True, doIndent=True)¶

Bases: object

C¶

alias of Constants

DO_INDENT = False¶
EXTENSION = None¶
ID = None¶
ROOT_PATH = None¶
block(component)¶

Generic block, called at any block opening. To be redefined by inheriting builder classes. Default behavior is to do nothing.

copyTree(srcPath, dstPath, force=False)¶
error(s)¶
getComponentFileName(root, component)¶

Answer the file path of the component. @@@ This should be based on URL too.

getCurrentArticleId()¶

Answer the id of the current article, as defined in the URL by @self.C.PARAM_ARTICLE@. Answer @self.C.DEFAULT_ARTICLEID@ if the parameter is not defined.

getExtension()¶

Answer the default extension of the output file of this type of builder. Typically @self.EXTENSION@ is answered.

getFilePath(component, root=None)¶

Answer the file path of @component@.

getParamItems()¶

Answer the @(name, value)@ tuple of URL params.

getParamNames()¶

Answer the names of the params in the URL

getPath()¶

Answer the path of the current URL, e.g. to select the right article data for this page. In CSS/SASS this gets overwritten by answering the path of the model document.

getResult()¶

Check if there is only one output writer left. This call should be made at the end of a rendering. Pop the writer and answer the result.

getUrl()¶

Answer the url of the current page. To be implemented by inheriting classes that actually knows about URLs. Default behavior is to do nothing.

initialize()¶

To be redefined by inheriting builder classes. Default behavior is to nothing.

initializeResult(result)¶

Initialize the @self.result@ from the optional result stack.

isType(builderType)¶

Answer the boolean flag if @self@ builder is of builderType. In normal processing of the page this should never be necessary, but the test can be used by code that otherwise will do a lot of content processing (such as image scaling) in the CSS building phase. Also it can be used to cut loops in content, to avoid identical definitions showing up in CSS. The comparison is not case-sensitive. builderType can be a single string or a list/tuple of strings.

makeDirectory(path)¶

Make sure that the directory of path (as file) exists. Otherwise create it. Answer the directory path for convenience of the caller.

newResultWriter(name=None)¶
newline(count=1)¶
output(s)¶

Output the @s@ string to the result stream.

peekResult()¶

Answer the current writer stream.

popNameResult()¶

Answer the tuple of @writer.name@ and the writer result.

popResult()¶

Answer the writer result if it exists. Answer @None@ otherwise.

pushResult(writer=None, name=None)¶

Push the optional writer. If the attribute is @None@, then create a new writer.

save(component, root=None, path=None)¶

Save the @self.getResult()@ in path. If the optional makeDirectory attribute is @True@ (default is @True@) then create the directories in the path if they don’t exist.

saveAsFile(path, content, makeDir=False)¶

Save content as a file under path. If the file exists it is overwritten. If @makeDirs@ is @True@ (default is @False@), the try to create the directory first.

setCurrentArticleId(aid)¶
snippet(component, name)¶

Allows inheriting (PHP) classes to save the block code to another snippet file, by redefining this method. Default behavior is to do nothing

tabIn()¶
tabOut()¶
tabs()¶

“Output tabs to the current level and add newlines, depending on the setting of @self._newline@ (string with newlines) and <code>self._tabLevel</code> (number of indents).

Bases: xierpa3.builders.sassbuilder.SassBuilder

Used for dispatching component.build_sass, if components want to define builder dependent behavior.

alias of Constants

getResult()¶

If there is any compiled result from SASS to CSS, then answer it. Otherwise answer the result of @self.popResult()@.

initialize()¶
save(component, path=None, root=None, styleType=None)¶

Style type is one of [‘nested’, ‘expanded’, ‘compact’, ‘compressed’]. Given by the url parameter “/css-nested”.

xierpa3.builders.htmlbuilder module¶

alias of Constants

EXTENSION = 'html'¶
ID = 'html'¶
XXXcssUrl(css)¶
block(component)¶

Optional space for a component to build the opening of a block. This does <b>not</b> automatically build a <b>div</div> since that is not flexible enough. To be redefined by inheriting builder classed. Default behavior is to do nothing, except showing the <b>component.selector</b> as comment/

buildCssLinks(component)¶

Create the CSS links inside the head. /css-<SASS_STYLENAME> defines the type of CSS output from the Sass compiler. The CSS parameter must be one of [‘nested’, ‘expanded’, ‘compact’, ‘compressed’]

buildFavIconLinks(component)¶

Build the favicon link, from the result of <b>component.adapter.getFavIcon()</b>. If the result is <b>None</b> then ignore.

buildFontLinks(component)¶

Build the webfont links of they are defined in <b>components.fonts</b>. Ignore if <b>self.C.useOnline()</b> is <b>False</b>.

buildJavascript(component)¶
buildMetaDescription(component)¶

Build the meta tag with description of the site for search engines, if available in the adapter.

buildMetaKeyWords(component)¶

Build the meta tag with keywords of the site for search engines, if available in the adapter.

editor(component)¶
element(**kwargs)¶

Elements are used for local CSS definitions. Ignored by HTML output.

getUrl()¶

Answer the url of the current page. To be implemented by inheriting classes that actually knows about urls. Default behavior is to do nothing.

ieExceptions()¶
image(component, class_=None)¶
initialize()¶
isEditor()¶
jsUrl(js)¶

Alternative to jQuery: http://vanilla-js.com

linkBlock(component, **kwargs)¶
page(component)¶

Builds the header of an HTML document. Note that the inheriting PhPBuilder uses the result of this method to generate the header.php file, as a separate result stream.

save(component, root=None, path=None, extension=None)¶

Save the file in path.

setViewPort()¶
supportMediaQueries()¶
text(componentOrText, **kwargs)¶

If in <b>self._svgMode</b> output as SVG tags. Otherwise just output if plain text string. If it is a components, then get it’s text string.

theme(component)¶

xierpa3.builders.phpbuilder module¶

class xierpa3.builders.phpbuilder.PhpBuilder(e=None, result=None, verbose=True, doIndent=True)¶

Bases: xierpa3.builders.htmlbuilder.HtmlBuilder

The <b>PhpBuilder checks if the there is already a PHP frame work at the target directory of the site, otherwise the default framework is copied there. Then the multiple result streams are saved at the destination in the framework.

ATTR_POSTFIX = 'php'¶
C¶

alias of Constants

EXTENSION = 'php'¶
ID = 'php'¶
XXXclear(result=None)¶
buildCssLinks(component)¶

Create the CSS links inside the head. /css-<SASS_STYLENAME> defines the type of CSS output from the Sass compiler. The CSS parameter must be one of [‘nested’, ‘expanded’, ‘compact’, ‘compressed’]

page(component)¶

Put the result of <b>self.page()</b> by the parent class HtmlBuilder in a separate result stream, that can be save into header.php. This method assumes that the parent method builds _div+_body+_html, to fit the standard footer.php file structure.

save(component, root=None, path=None, extension=None)¶

Save the result streams in the PHP framework.

xierpa3.builders.sassbuilder module¶

class xierpa3.builders.sassbuilder.SassBuilder(e=None, result=None, verbose=True, doIndent=True)¶

Bases: xierpa3.builders.builderparts.xmltransformerpart.XmlTransformerPart, xierpa3.builders.builder.Builder

Build the SASS source for a given component. For automatic Sass compilation, use inheriting CssBuilder instead.

>>> from xierpa3.components import Page, Column
>>> from xierpa3.constants.constants import Constants as C
>>> column = Column(writingmode=C.WM_HORIZONTALTB)
>>> p = Page(components=column)
>>> sb = SassBuilder()
>>> p.build(sb)
>>> sb.getResult()
'

/* Start page “page” */

/* End page “page” */’
ATTR_POSTFIX = 'css'¶
C¶

alias of Constants

DEFAULT_PATH = 'css/style.css'¶
EXTENSION = 'scss'¶
ID = 'sass'¶
XXXcss3_style(value)¶
classmethod XXXgetCssBackgroundSizeValue(value, object='background-size', browser=None)¶

<doc> The <code>getCssBackgroundSizeValue<code> method answers browser dependent css <code>background-size</code> value.<br/> </doc>

classmethod XXXgetCssBoxShadowValue(color, x=None, y=None, blur=None, inout=None, browser=None, object='box')¶

<doc> The <code>cssBoxShadowValue<code> method answers browser dependent css <code>box-shadow</code> value.<br/> Or, if <attr>object</attr> is <code>text</code>, answers browser dependent css <code>text-shadow</code> value.<br/> The value can be a list or tuple, as in <code>self.css(ids=”...”, boxshadow=(“#888888”, 6, 6, 20))</code><br/> Or it may be separate arguments as can be used in a <code>style</code> attribute:<br/> self.div(style=self.cssBoxShadowValue(“#888888”, 6, 6, 20))<br/> self.div(style=self.cssBoxShadowValue(“#888888”, 6, 6, 20, “inset”))<br/> self.div(style=self.cssBoxShadowValue(“inset 6px 6px 20px #888888”)<br/> Omitting the optional <attr>browser</attr> attribute will result in the output for all browsers. </doc>

classmethod XXXgetCssBoxShadowValues(color, x=None, y=None, blur=None, inout=None)¶
classmethod XXXgetCssGradientValue(startcolor, endcolor=None, x0='left', x1='left', y0='top', y1='bottom', type='linear', browser=None)¶

<doc> The <code>cssBoxShadowValue<code> method answers browser dependent css <code>gradient</code> value.<br/> self.div(style=self.cssGradientValue({‘startcolor’:’#fff000’,’endcolor’:’#999999’}))<br/> self.div(style=self.cssGradientValue(‘#fff000’,’#999999’))<br/> <br/> <em>Browser dependent formatting:</em><br/> background: -webkit-gradient(linear, left top, left bottom, from(#fff000), to(#999999));<br/> background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #fff000, #999999);<br/> filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorstr=’#fff000’, endColorstr=’#999999’);<br/> Omitting the optional <attr>browser</attr> attribute will result in the output for all browsers. </doc>

a(**kwargs)¶
b(**kwargs)¶
block(component)¶

Ignore additional classes here. They should be defined separately by the user. This builds the main component class name CSS. Test if component.BUILD_CSS is True, components may be HTML only, not showing up in the CSS. Make nesting of output stream, to test if a current block created content, so the headers can be skipped.

blockquote(**kwargs)¶
br(**kwargs)¶
buildHookProperties(name, value)¶

Build the CSS properties, depending if the hook <b>’css3_‘+name</b> method exists. If the value is an instance of <b>Media</b> then the attributes are generated on another output stream.

buildMedia(component)¶

Here all style have been written. What remains is the to sort and output the collected @media expression of <i>component</i> as media queries. The collected <b>Media</b> instances will generate a selector that is related to the path of their parent styles and objects.

buildMediaItem(media)¶
buildSelectorsMedia(selectors, media)¶
buildStyle(style)¶

If there is <i>style</i> defined, run trough its attributes to match withs corresponding CSS methods. This way the CSS-related attributes are separated from the others. For this reason some the the standard attributes have other names, e.g. there is a <b>style.url</b> and <b>style.cssurl</b>.

buildStyles(styles)¶

Build each style in <i>styles</i>.

div(**kwargs)¶
element(tag=None, **kwargs)¶

Element is used to define CSS values for elements that are part of an XML tree, where they cannot be reached for specification. Using element as pseudo tag, allows the definintion of styles for elements that are otherwise hidden.

classmethod getCssBorderRadiusCornerValue(value, topbottom, leftright, browser=None)¶

The <code>cssBorderRadiusCornerValue<code> method answers browser dependent CSS <code>border-radius</code> value of a specific corner.<br/> Omitting the optional <attr>browser</attr> attribute will result in the output for all browsers. </doc>

classmethod getCssBorderRadiusValue(value, browser=None)¶

The <code>cssBorderRadiusValue<code> method answers browser dependent CSS <code>border-radius</code> value.<br/> Omitting the optional <attr>browser</attr> attribute will result in the output for all browsers. </doc>

classmethod getCssBrowserValue(value, attribute, browser=None)¶
classmethod getCssFontSmoothValue(value, browser=None)¶

<doc> The <code>get</code> method answers the browser dependent css for font smoothing. Values are one of <code>[‘none’, ‘antialiased’, ‘subpixel-antialiased’]</code>. </doc>

classmethod getCssOpacityValue(value, browser=None)¶

The <code>cssBorderRadiusValue<code> method answers browser dependent css <code>border-radius</code> value.

classmethod getCssTransformValue(scale=None, skew=None, rotate=None, browser=None)¶

The <code>buildCssTransformValue<code> method answers browser dependent css <code>border-radius</code> value. <br/> Omitting the optional <attr>browser</attr> attribute will result in the output for all browsers.

getCurrentArticleId()¶

Always answer @None@, to trigger the execution of style method, built into components.

getFilePath(component, root=None)¶

Answer the CSS file path of @component@.

getSassVariable(name, value, cnt=0)¶

Build the name-value. This is done in some steps, in order to create the Sass variables. If there is already a name-value match in self.variables, then use that reference. If the value is a list or dict, then don’t create a Sass variable, feed directly into the CSS hook call.

getSelector(tag, id, selectorPath, selector, class_, class_postfix, pseudo)¶

Build the selector for this tag, depending on the setting of id and input selector attributes. The order of interpretations is: * selectorpath * selector * “#” + id * class_postfix * class_postfix + ”:” + pseudo * class_ * tag * tag + ”:” + +pseudo

page(component)¶

Mark the CSS start of the specific page <i>component</i> style. Called by block of <b>Page</b> component.

popFirst()¶

Pop and answer the current dictionary of selectors for this block and answer it.

pre(**kwargs)¶
pushFirst()¶

Push a new empty dictionary of selectors on the firstSelectors stack.

reset()¶

Resets fallback values for CSS.

save(component, root=None, path=None)¶

Export the current state of the Sass to <i>path</i>. First the set of collected variables and then the result it self.

script(**kwargs)¶

Ignore all Javascript.

section(**kwargs)¶
select(**kwargs)¶
classmethod selector2Class(class_)¶

Format the class to comma separated output. Takes any construction of strings and lists. class_ can be [‘name’, ‘name’] or ‘name name’ or [‘name’, (‘name’, ‘name’)].

span(**kwargs)¶
styleBlock(selector)¶

Open the CSS with the selector. If the style does not have a selector then don’t open the block and don’t indent. This way the CSS keeps the original indented position. The reverse happens when closing the block.

sup(**kwargs)¶
svg(**kwargs)¶
table(**kwargs)¶
tag(tag, **kwargs)¶

Used for non-component blocks. Build the <i>tag</i> with the given arguments as selector and SASS source attribute values. If there is a attribute ending with “_css” then ignore the output of the attribute with the same name, without “_css” ending. This offers the opportunity to specifically describe css attribute, preferred above the generic attribute value. All attributes that have the postfix of another builder are ignored. Make forked nesting of output streams, to test if a current block created content, so the headers can be skipped if there already is an identical selector-content match inside the current block.

td(**kwargs)¶
text(textComponent)¶

Ignore output if <i>textComponent</i> is a plain text string.

th(**kwargs)¶
theme(component)¶

Build the reset code for the default values of HTML elements. Called by block of <b>theme</b> component. Open the theme block (omitted if the style has no selector) and build the style of <b>component.style</b>.

tr(**kwargs)¶
ul(**kwargs)¶
